questions.text: A woman would get anxious, mood swings with occasional sleep disturbance and weeping episodes after birth of child and got referred from Obstetrics dept after 5 days post delivery. What is most probable diagnosis of this condition ?

A 16y old female patient was referred to psychiatrist by physician for having irresistible urges to eat (craving for food), excessive eating followed by episodes of self induced vomiting. She was also using appetite suppressant drugs. Diagnosis?
A patient with suspected opiodoverdose, comes to emergency room with respiratory distress, bradycardia and hypotension. Which drug will best for reversal of respiratory depression?
A Patient on antidepressant presents with altered sensorium and hypotension. ECG shows wide QRS complexes. Select the most appropriate treatment?
A schizophrenia patient was having obsessions, thought insertion, derailment and delusion of persecution. Which of these is included in formal thought disorder?
A 16 year old female patient presented with overfamiliarity, flight of ideas, elevated mood, increased sexual desire, pseudo-hallucinations.

During the course of psychotherapy, the therapist had mixed conscious and unconscious feelings towards the patient, irrespective of the patients mind. Therapist keeps his own unmet needs towards the patient. This is known as:

An old man wassitting in balcony naked showing his body parts, neighbors complained to police and said that he does this particularly in evening in front of people when they are walking in the public park.
Which of the following is not seen in a patient who used heavy dose of cocaine IV (cocaine intoxication)?
A patient of schizophrenia was taking the medicine triflupromazine and developed Parkinson like symptoms. Treatment?

A patient with a diagnosis of depression was started on Imipramine, the treatment was given for 2 weeks. After that the relatives noticed that the patient developed new symptoms like, being excessively cheerful, increased excitement, wearing of colourful clothes and increased talking. What is the most appropriate next step in treatment?

options.label: D
options.text: Discontinue imipramine and add sodium valproate

questions.correct_answer: D. Discontinue imipramine and add sodium valproate

questions.text: An 18y old first year MBBS girl student, has been experiencing short last episodes of tightness sensation in chest, anxiety and feeling of impending doom. One episode per week for last 3-4 months. The student repeatedly came 3 times to OPD with same symptoms. On investigations, all findings were with in normal limits and she was then referred to psychiatrist. Likely diagnosis (*)

A patient having decreased sleep and decreased appetite for last 6 months, also having death wish and has now developed a new symptom for last 2 weeks in form of voices telling him to die, along with persistence of previous symptoms. Probable diagnosis?
The marked EEG (rectangle box) in below image is of: (*)
A patient was on lithium for bipolar disorder, now fasting for religious reasons, developed symptoms of vomiting, coarse tremors and dizziness. Next best line of investigation: (*)
Most widely abused substance causing dependence?
Maximum duration for which a person can take himself voluntary admission under the mental health act?
Morbid fear of darkness
Premature ejaculation is a defect in which phase of sexual cycle :
Confusion assessment method is used in which of following:
Severe depression and feeling of misery without any reason is seen in :
Risk factor for delusional disorder are all except:
The test which can detect patient reaction when told about an event, which is already known to him, is known as:
Exposure and response prevention therapy has poor prognosis with which of the following components of OCD:
Not true about somnambulism?
Drug used for smoking and tobacco cessation?
All are components of Sigmund freud’s dream work except?
Stereotype is best defined by which of the following?

A 35year old man presents to psychiatry OPD, he has a history of RTA 2 months back with multiple bone fractures. He recovered physically, but for last one and half months, he has been having sleep disturbances with dreams in which the incident of accident was getting repeated and he wakes up often feeling anxious. Also he used to get startled while walking on road hearing the sounds of vehicles. Which of the following is the diagnosis?
As per “American Psychological association”, what is the new term used in DSM-5 for “mental retardation”?
Which of the following best differentiates “delirium” from “dementia”? (**)
A 50year old male patient who is a chronic alcoholic, presented to emergency with irrelevant talks, tremor and sweating. He had his last drink 3 days back. What will the probable diagnosis?
Recollection of repressed memories with appropriate affective response by?
Squeeze technique used in treatment of what condition?
The term “minimal brain dysfunction” was used to describe? (*)
All of the following are “habit forming disorders” except?

A middle aged women presents with episodes of sudden onset breathlessness, palpitations, tremors, sweating, fear of having an impending cardiac arrest/heart attack since 6 months...increased heart rate,....5 to 6 episodes per month..., no triggers for such episode. each episode lasts for 30 minutes. All investigations were normal.

Patient of schizophrenia was first started on a haloperidol and thioridazine, but he wasn’t responding to that medicine, so was switched to another drug, but after switching he developed hyperglycaemia, dyslipidaemia and excessive salivation. What could be the offending drug?
Clinical history is suggestive of premature ejaculation in male, with history of relationship conflicts with wife. Non pharmacological treatment for the couple used in this condition?
History of chronic alcohol abuse now presented with acute onset confusion, 6th nerve palsy, gaze palsy, ataxia. Likely diagnosis?

45 yr old female has feeling of nervousness/feeling tensed, having stomach upset with heartburn/dyspepsia and diarrhea since many years. She also tells her family members are also tensed and nervous. Which additional symptom can be seen in this patient?
Which of the following drug used in ADHD, is SNRI?
A 32 year old male needs to be dressed in female lingerie and high heels to feel aroused and have an intercourse with a female, he denies of any sexual attraction towards male, what is the diagnosis:
Which of the following drug is used in “Opiod maintenance”?

A 65 year old chronic alcoholic who was indulged in binge drinking 10 days back, was brought to emergency in unconscious state. Normal findings on CT scan brain. His blood glucose was 45mg/dl. What treatment should be initiated?
questions.correct_answer: B. Intravenous Thiamine followed by dextrose

questions.text: A 30 year old male, he is calm and charming in front of psychiatrist, behaves good with family members, but when he is out. He bunks classes, breaks traffic rules, often gets into fights with friends, involved in police interrogation also. What is likely diagnosis?

A 25 year female was referred to psychiatrist from plastic surgeon. She wants her entire face changed, repeated visits to plastic surgeons for face deformity, she repeatedly checks her face in mirror. She would constantly examine herself on utensils and spoons complaining about spots and blemishes that are not present. She wouldn’t change her mind even after family members constantly advising her. Which is best preferred treatment?
ADHD in childhood, persisting in adolescence, is risk factor for development of which of following?

A girl with a history of loss of consciousness episodes only in front of family members and only in day time. Patient can recall the events at the time of episode, when she regains conscious after 5-10 min, no tongue bite, no history of fecal or urinary incontinence. EEG and MRI brain were normal. Select the true statement regarding her treatment:-
A Mother reported that her girl has ingested a substance of unknown dose and unknown form. She presented with tachycardia, hypertension, mydriasis, paranoia or euphoria. What could be the drug?

A patient brought to hospital after a road traffic accident with symptoms of tremors, irritability and confusion. He has a history of consuming alcohol daily. Which of the following drug is used to avoid the withdrawal symptoms?
